turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Siege of Pemaquid (1696).
turn.1: What happened at the Siege of Pemaquid?
turn.2: There were eighteen cannon mounted in the gun ports of six-foot thick walls that rose ten to twenty feet above the ground.
turn.3: Who was the leader of the British?
turn.4: The fort was rebuilt under the direction of Captain John March with the assistance of Benjamin Church.
turn.6: The commander of the fort was Captain Pasco Chubb.
turn.7: How did Chubb lead the Americans?
turn.8: He violated an assembly that was held under a flag of truce, by killing a number of the Abenaki chiefs who were present (including Chief Aspinquid).

turn.11: Did the British or the Americans win?
turn.12: Led by Saint-Castin, the Abenaki Nation joined forces with D'Iberville at Pentagouet.
